Title: Software Development & Networking
Summary: I'm a software developer engineer, "the wifi guy", and a teacher of the art of writing 'Hello World's.  More? Alright, since you asked!  I started writing websites in PHP in 2008, and now write in Python, Ruby on Rails and JavaScript (React). I learnt Java through academia and obtained the top score at the University of London's Object-Oriented Programming examination in 2015. To that end, I got Proxor-2 certified in 2017.  While I see the benefits of object-oriented programming, I've also implemented simple python scripting for an automation framework for data pipelines in AWS to perform ETL workloads and data quality checks of processed Tableau data. This makes such checks and pipelines accessible to all levels of engineers, including analysts who may not have programming backgrounds.  Some might say that strongly-typed languages slow development speed, but I find that it helps in long-term maintainability and in development teams, which led me to use TypeScript while working in Visa and in all my subsequent JS work. Coupled with strong CI/CD workflows, this has brought about a higher level of confidence in the code that we produced at Hackwagon Academy, where I wrote a full-stack, multi-tenant HR/payroll platform to support the operations team's unique processes.  Other than writing code, maintaining network equipment takes up most of my time. It gives my slight OCD a good kick when WiFi deployments are appropriately sized and secured. Other than that, I also enjoy helping my friends out with their programming questions, which is why I used to spend weekends in Singapore at Hackwagon.com teaching Python and Full-stack Web Development. Otherwise, I'm on StackOverflow reviewing queues or on GitHub submitting PRs. I've also recently gotten my 4th professional certification, as an AWS Cloud Practitioner.   Check out my coding profile on Github @shrmnk - I had over a thousand commits in 2018 and probably more now in 2019.

Title: Product Manager at GrabPay | FinTech | Logistics | Ex-Lazada
Summary: “Grab is more than just the leading ride-hailing and mobile payments app in Southeast Asia. We use data and technology to improve everything from transportation to payments and logistics across a region of more than 620 million people. Working with governments, drivers, passengers, and charities, we aim to unlock the true potential of the region by solving problems that hinder progress.    Grab began as a taxi-hailing app in 2012, but has extended its product platform to include private car services (GrabCar & GrabShare), motorcycle taxis (GrabBike), social carpooling (GrabHitch) and last mile delivery (GrabExpress). We are focused on pioneering new commuting alternatives for drivers and passengers with an emphasis on speed, safety, and reliability. Currently we offer services in Singapore, Indonesia, Philippines, Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam; however, we also have R&D offices in Bangalore, Beijing, & Seattle.”   Graduated with Bachelor of Science (Information Systems) from Singapore Management University. Title: Sophomore in Singapore Management University
Summary: I believe in diversity, stability and innovation.   It is important to me to skill myself in a diverse range of expertise. I believe that having a diversified set of skills is not only essential to the current workplace, but it also provides me with stability.  In this volatile day and age, it is important for me to find stability in the work I do and the life I live to achieve peace. Witnessing first-hand the horrors a single recession can do to a man's pride and even his will to live, I vowed to myself to never have to let myself, or anyone I hold close to me go through such an ordeal again.   While diversity and stability brings me peace, innovation brings me joy. Innovation allows me to think creatively, and execute ideas that can be absolutely ridiculous, yet engaging and fun! Innovation is also the criteria that is required for companies to get ahead of each other and boost their competitiveness. In my opinion, it brings satisfaction to the innovator, and colour to the world.  Hence, diversity, stability and innovation are goals that I keep close to my heart. I seek to improve myself every day to get closer to these goals as I believe they can bring me peace and joy, and benefit the society and workplaces that I reside in.

My main project revolved around creating a user flow for a CRM dashboard that chains marketing campaigns according to set conditions, and other actions such as sending a notification. Title: Marketing Communications Intern at CapitaLand
Summary: Being lost and scared is exactly what I felt when I first came to Singapore to pursue my degree. It feels like being trapped in a totally alien environment with no support system that you used to have. In conclusion, I believe no one would want to be there.   Nevertheless, I started to learn that being lost is a blessing in disguise, and I would like to thank all those difficult days in shaping who I am today. I still have a long way to go, but I learned a few things, from becoming more independent and hardworking to being less selfish; just to name a few.  I also took on leadership roles and internships to improve myself. From there, I met a lot of wonderful people, got exposed to real world problems, and realised my passion in people, finance and marketing.   Yes, I started to become obsessed in helping other people. It brings such a genuine joy in the art of giving, for both the giver and the recipient; especially when you’ve experienced how bad you needed those helps back in the days. This also applies to work. What customers want nowadays is not only a great outcome, but also a great process. If we start to be sincere in what we do in helping them to achieve their goals, we would not only be successful, but also personally accomplished.   When I feel like taking a break from the hectic university and job-hunting routine, I will be reading books, watching comedy shows, movies and sport clips. And yes, I love sport, so much. Sport teaches me a lot of amazing lessons, from perseverance, problem solving, and not to mention it increases both your mental and physical health.   At the core, I am a student, and I always will be. I will never stop learning from people and circumstances while hoping to make the best out of it at the same time.  I know I might be knocked down again someday along the line, but I hope I will get back up every time it happens.  Anyway, maybe it’s true when people say “you need to get lost in order to be found”.  No matter how cliche that might sound, I feel that’s the best way to summarise my whole journey so far.  Feel free to reach out if you wanted to have any conversation about life, emotional support or work-related topics, especially in finance and marketing field.

Title: Branding and Technology Enthusiast | Storyteller at Crayon Data
Summary: I am relentlessly obsessed with technology and how it impacts us, from the big-picture moral and ethical implications, down to how it affects our daily lives. I live for great stories, and treat the world as my stage. Every sales pitch, every marketing collateral and every impression I get to make, I see it as a chance to tell my story.  My passion for life drives my tenacity to do crazy things, like that one time I decided to hike 27 kilometres in the great Canadian outback full of wild grizzly bears in nothing but running shoes, leggings and a t-shirt – that became the most fulfilling day of my life, and remains a great story to tell. The one quote I live by is to "do one thing every day that scares you”; this exact same philosophy has always driven me to play with the boundaries when executing my work, allowing me to deliver creative solutions time after time.  In my professional career, I've brought startups into new markets, laid the groundwork for new business partnerships and closed overseas deals; I've spread our stories far and wide beyond our local markets, supported partnerships and distributors in localisation efforts and done it all with pizzazz.  My interests lie in the cross roads of storytelling and the tech industry and I welcome good conversation on anything along those two planes; come talk AI, marketing and branding to me!

Title: Helping public and private sector clients navigate the Risk Management transformation journey
Summary: The death of a dream, is a birth of destiny - is what governs that way I lead my life. Having gone through a personal predicament when I was in my teenage year had turned my world upside down but it certainly made me rise like a phoenix, transformed and reborn. The values of resilient and optimism that the incident has taught has moulded me into the individual I am today.   I am currently an Associate with KPMG Risk Consulting specialising in Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) with cross trained experiences in Sustainability Services (SS) and Internal Audit, Risk Compliance Services (IARCS). I have graduated from Singapore Management University (SMU) with a Bachelor of Accountancy with a Data Analytics Track and a second major in Finance.   As an intrinsically motivated and proactive individual, I am always inclined to the generation of new ideas and consistently push myself to develop innovative solutions that help others and provide value to the institutions in which I work.   I have held several key leadership positions in SMU such as Global Talent Supply Manager for AIESEC and Director for Citi-SMU Financial Literacy Club for Youth Adults. I am not only used to wearing many hats which I sincerely enjoy, but also thrive in an environment where no two work days are the same.Aside from being highly adaptable, I am an organised and meticulous individual that have a strong ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet strict deadlines.  Given my experience, leadership positions and regular interaction with people in my club, I have mastered the skills in managing teams, stakeholder engagements and collaborating with people from diverse backgrounds.   Also, being a firm believer of Franklin’s adage that service to humanity is the great aim and end of all learning, I actively took part in community service projects to contribute back to the society and enrich the life of others.

Summary: I have a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and services industry. Skilled in consulting, production support, and service with applied knowledge.  Having worked with data, my interests have revolved around Operations Management, Business Strategy/Solutions and Organization Structure. I started looking at how businesses have realized the importance of utilizing big data analytics to maximize their profits, where actionable insights are derived from data related to both the organization as well as the industry. Data analytics is also required in order to maintain sustained growth of the business operations and to compete in the market in an era where the customers are flooded with ever-increasing choices. The major aspects of concern for any business is the speed and accuracy of making a business decision, and data analytics covers these concerns with ease as its principal of operation is based on the statistical modelling of data and usage of analytical tools to convert raw data into useful information. Through the same, I have come to appreciate business analytics as the backbone of success for any business and moving forth, I envision myself within the same sphere of decision makers who determine the tide of businesses across the globe.  Currently pursuing my Master’s degree in Analytics at SMU, I am open to opportunities that enable me to make use of data for innovation, optimization and solving real, large scale issues in the analytics field which in turn facilitates game changing business decisions.  Outside of work and studies, I am very much passionate about digital art, and I manage an online art gallery in DeviantART. I am also interested in video games, the genre being MOBA and RTS. Chelsea’s previous working experience at a recruitment firm has sharpened her ability to connect the right people with the right opportunities. It has also honed her listening and communication skills, enabling her to better serve HR professionals.  In addition, as former events curator and PR executive for a start-up firm, she proved her competence in events management, organising a forum and delivering client-servicing skills to ensure the smooth outcome of the event.  Chelsea is also passionate about understanding human relations both in the community and workplace. Her fields of study in Psychology and Human Resources have equipped her with the insight and analytical abilities to accurately assess and develop balanced OD solutions for PACE’s clients.  Chelsea holds a Bachelor of Social Sciences (Double Major in Psychology & Human Resources) from the Singapore Management University. Title: Business Development Associate at Singtel
Summary: Moses is a business development associate working in Singtel with an interest in helping to develop the data economy and 5G ecosystems in Singapore.   He graduated from Singapore Management University, with double majors in both Sociology and Arts & Culture Management. With an intrinsic motivation to make a difference to the community around him, Moses aspires to focus his career for the greater good of society. This affirmed interest in industry development has since spurred him to assume complementary roles in both his career and in his past-time that continually drives his passion to create a better society.  Moses is also passionate about the development of the arts in Singapore, especially in the music sector. From his works in the Singapore music scene to past volunteerism, Moses strives to apply his acquired knowledge and experience for the enhancement of art in Singapore.
Organization Description 3: In February 2017, Moses joined the Singapore metal band, Coup de Grace, as their 5th member and keyboardist. Since joining Coup de Grace, Moses has been actively involved with the band's compositions and has taken on the role as the band administrator for marketing collateral and editorials.  In May 2018, Moses was involved in Coup de Grace's maiden EP release, Interitus, having recorded all keyboard parts for every track. He also oversaw the Interitus EP Launch event held in May 2018, including marketing and merchandising.  Between November 2018 and March 2019 , Moses was also involved in a collaboration with Sirius Project Productions in organising the Seasons of Aggression gig series.  With Coup de Grâce's first full length album, Moses contributed all keyboard and sfx parts heard across all 7 songs. see less
Organization Description 4: As an arts and culture management student, Moses took on a teaching assistant role in his senior year for the course Advanced Arts and Culture Management (ACM004) under Professor Hoe Su Fern. His responsibilities include course administration and class management.
Organization Description 5: While in e2i, Moses was tasked with assisting in the organisation of several Job Fairs as well as the spearheading of the Jobseekers & Job Fair Data Analysis Project. In the latter project, he archived and analysed e2i registered Jobseekers’ demographics across early 2017, purposed to redefine job fair outreach and coverage.  In the duration of this project, he also began two sub-projects to uncover residential areas where e2i registered Jobseekers reside and the “Jobseekers Survey” to find out Jobseekers’ satisfaction levels. These data were used to identify potential areas of residence with higher unemployment rates while compiling and analysing the effectiveness of e2i Job Fairs held from July 2016 to June 2017. The project eventually enabled his team to identify key areas of improvement to the workflow and better re-strategize the development and planning of various types of Job Fairs.  Moses also teamed with his fellow intern in the assessment on e2i's internal Town Hall, seeking to boost attendance and engagement. Through this project, their team identified several areas of improvement and brainstormed potential solutions for their HR colleagues. see less
Organization Description 6: For both winter holidays of 2015 and 2016, Moses returned to SCS to assist the team in the copywriting, proof-reading and publication of the SCS Annual Report.
Organization Description 7: Moses was the founding member of the now-defunct Singapore rock band Matura, alongside Singaporean EDM artiste, Jasmine Sokko. The band was known for performing at distinguished event venues such as Dhoby Green Amphitheater and Meadows @ Gardens By The Bay alongside other local bands.  As the band manager of Matura, Moses designed and managed the band's media and publicity collateral. He also liaised with various event venues and gig organisers, most notably Anaki Records, for performance opportunities.  In May 2015, Moses was appointed as the Performance Arranger for the band. see less
Education Description 1: Moses is a double major student in both Sociology and Arts and Culture Management.

Organization Description 2: CREA is an economic research think tank that studies challenges facing ageing populations, to contribute a better understanding of the issues in Singapore and Asia Pacific. There are two main facets of CREA’s research. The first is the operation of the Singapore Life Panel® (SLP) built using data of about 12500 Singaporeans (couples and single people) aged 50 to 70 years. This panel runs on a monthly basis collecting rich data that provides an analytical picture of the evolving reality of Singapore’s ageing landscape. The SLP also adds critical statistical support to inform policymaking and research on ageing issues in Singapore. The second focus of the centre is the investigation of economic policy issues facing the elderly in Singapore, for example, health, retirement, pension and housing. CREA also studies international ageing policies and draws lessons for Singapore.  • Test monthly pre-launch data collection surveys used in the research panel • Collection and Sorting of Primary Data see less

Summary: www.thunderquote.com  [Speaker Bio] Kevin Ng is the Managing Director of Thunderquote.com, E-procurement Division  (ASEAN's most comprehensive business services portal - www.thunderquote.com),with hundreds of thousands of dollars of contracts handled per month from clients like NTUC, Mediacorp, Singtel, ST Kinetics and Singapore Press Holdings. He is involved in various panels & speakerships about Public and Private Procurement (Annual SME Study On Public Procurement 2016/2017, Global Supply Chain Council Indirect Procurement Forum 2018, presented the paper ’Smart Cities Need Smart Procurement’, Smart Cities In East Asia, ICMAC Bali 2017) represented Singapore as part of the Singapore delegation at the  Y&EE ASEAN +3 (ROK,PRC,JPN) Economic Forum in Phnom Penh, Cambodia 2017, and has been featured in Zaobao (Aug 5 2015), Huffington Post, Inc.com magazine and Yahoo Finance.  A veteran technology professional certified in project management and quality assurance(CAPM/Six Sigma), he has worked on over 5 technology product fields (including mPOS, event app engines, manpower scheduling, web ERP systems, and more), and is Vice Chair (Membership Engagement & Government Advocacy) & Vice President of the Association of International Procurement Technology & Standards. Organization Description 2: MGMT318-Design Thinking and Innovation  Design Thinking is a human-centric, interdisciplinary approach towards innovation that aims to help companies and startups change and innovate. This course introduces Design Thinking and its application to developing new “things” (i.e. products, services, experiences and business models). The course is divided into four main aspects, all interconnected but separately emphasized: (1) design methodologies (e.g. ethnographic research, brainstorming, prototyping), (2) the “thing” to be designed (3) attitudes and behaviors and (4) design contexts. Design contexts refer to the broader emerging context for designs and business, specifically, society (including different cultures and the poor), and the physical environment.  • Managed class administrative work for Professor Koh Zhixiu, Sean. • Liaised closely with our client - American Express (AMEX). • Mentored 4 groups of 6 students with project queries and deliveries. see less

Title: Year 3 Law Student at Singapore Management University
Summary: As Thomas Hobbes once said, “The law is the public’s conscience”. As a Year 3 Law student in Singapore Management University, I am committed to learning more about the law and how I can use it to help people who seek legal advice.   My current areas of interests are corporate law and data and privacy law. I also enjoy doing comparative legal research as I believe Singapore's legal system, though quite robust, can continue improving and learn from other countries.    In my free time, I love to gym and go for long-distance runs. I also love to play the classical guitar and read. To gain exposure and improve my interpersonal skills, I work part-time at Changi Airport as a healthcare assistant under Raffles Medical Group. I also tutor primary and secondary students Mathematics and English.  Currently, I am on student exchange at University of New South Wales, Australia, hence I apologise in advance if you have tried reaching out to me (SMS, calling) via my Singapore number. I can be contacted via Whatsapp with my SG number.

Title: Cyber Security Consultant (OSCP & CREST - CPSA) at PwC Singapore
Summary: Subash is a Risk Assurance Associate (IT Security & Controls) at PwC. Some of his responsibilities include web penetration testing, host configuration review, network vulnerability assessment, IT security process review and client management. Subash has worked on numerous government sector projects to review, assess and advice on security processes and implementations. Subash has also attained the CREST Practitioner Security Analyst certification and is looking forward to attaining his Offensive Security Certified Professional and CREST Registered Penetration Tester certifications by November 2019.  Subash graduated from Singapore Management University with a degree in Bachelor of Science (Information Systems) and a second major in Information Technology Security. Subash has a keen interest in both IT Security and Banking Technologies. During his course of study Subash was also a recipient of GIC's Sparks and Smiles Grant and Tampines West Scholarship.  Subash was the Public Relations Director with his school's student body, SISS. In this committee, he has helped in coordinating and organizing many successful events by working with SISS's external partners. Some of his responsibility included maintaining a good relationship with existing external partners and sourcing for new external partners mutually benefiting both the school and partners.  Subash is also very active in volunteerism. He is an active volunteer with Beyond Social Services as a Be-Friender which involves him guiding troubled youths onto the right path. He was also and active member of his school's Rotaract Club which involves him doing volunteer work with Admiralty Care Center with young children such as playing games, cooking, arts and craft and bring them on excursions.

Summary: I find great people and find them great houses. This all starts with a conversation. Title: Penultimate Student at Singapore Management University
Summary: Hey there, I am currently a Penultimate year student at Singapore Management University (SMU) and I am pursuing a degree in Accountancy with a Second Major in Finance. The past 3 years in SMU has nurtured and cultivated my passion for accountancy. I have always enjoyed working with numbers and pursuing this degree just has enhanced my love for this profession. Unraveling the realms of knowledge in this profession is something I look forward to everyday when I attend the respective modules in SMU. I have been in the Dean’s List for AY 16/17 and AY 17/18 and this further exemplifies my abilities in this profession.   I always believe improving myself and doing things outside of just studies. Alongside studies, I took on positions as the Chairman for the SMU Freshmen Orientation 2017 and the position of Honorary General Secretary for the SMU Student Association (SMUSA) 14th Council and 18th SMUSA Executive Committee. These experiences have helped me hone my leadership and people management skills. In my first year in SMU, I also decided to be part of an Overseas Community Service Project to Chiangmai, Thailand where we taught the Thai Kids English as well as built a toilet for them.  Above all, I enjoy making new friends as it definite helps to break the monotony in life. Furthermore, I enjoy travelling as I enjoy seeking out experiences and moments which will remain with me for life. I hope to complete travelling around the whole world in the next 20 years. I have thus far travelled to London, Scotland, Dubai, Nepal to name a few.  In my free time, I head to the gym to unwind after a long day in school. If not, I would also play badminton or cricket with friends.

Organization Description 1: People Advisory Services (PAS) shapes and delivers the part of business strategy that depends on people. As a PAS professional, you will have the opportunity to work with global clients to understand and address some of their largest and most complex people-related challenges, and ultimately improve and drive valuable and sustainable business results. We focus on engagements that relate to performance, talent, systems, reward, mobility and analytics.  In PAS, we help our clients with:  Performance – effectively manage change through developing innovative,digitally centric behavior led strategies to support clients through the transformation. This could be for operating model changes, digital / technology change and M&A.  HR Transformation – including all elements from the design HR operating models including shared services, center of excellence, organization design, incorporating new HR digital technologies and the overall improvement of HR process efficiency.  Talent optimization – Develop data supported workforce strategies and employee value propositions, manage talent, address people risk, develop capability at all levels, and focus on organizational development activities including culture change.  Rewards Optimization – Develop reward and governance framework that is aligned with business strategy; ensuring the framework drives business strategy and objectives, mitigate risk elements of reward and governance work, and optimize returns from reward components (compensation and benefits) to engender greater talent well-being and retention. see less

We provide the situational awareness first responders need when a moment brings catastrophe. Motorola Solutions helps people be their best in the moments that matter. Title: Final Year Student at Singapore Management University
Summary: Final year information systems undergraduate expected to graduate in 2020.   Since young, I always had an interest in all things IT-related. Whenever I encounter an issue in the technological domain, I will always try to get to the root of the problem and make an effort to understand the cause of it. In my early days, you will find me tweaking Microsoft Window's configuration settings to figure out the full range of features the operating system have to offer us, or tinkering around with the router's configuration settings to improve the network bandwidth limit.  This initial curiosity was what spurred me to pursue a diploma in Network Systems & Security Systems, where I acquired a foundation in networking. During this stint, I am fortunate to be given the opportunity to assist the researchers of A*STAR in a department experimenting with the usage of wireless sensor micro-controller boards to form a real-time data-driven network made of out sensors, giving me my first experience in IOT.  Now, I am currently working towards a degree in Information Systems. I have identified that my passion lies in incorporating technology into our daily lives as I believe that they are enablers that have the ability to create more good than harm when implemented properly. Whether it will be developing a web application that will automate manual processes, or making use of a new technology that will revamped and streamlined an organisation's processes, they have the potential to add value to the things we do. Title: Fresh Graduate from Singapore Management University
Summary: I am a fresh graduate from Singapore Management University (SMU) where collaboration and interaction in the classroom are highly valued upon. Throughout my course of study, my experience in handling academic projects have nurtured me to become a good team player. SMU's provision of several class participation opportunities in every seminar has also helped to train me to become an eloquent speaker and develop my critical thinking skills.  People around me know me as a highly creative individual who can always be trusted to come up with a new approach to solving problems. Being a critical thinker and a pragmatic person enable me to understand the business problem and the audience before suggesting ideas. I can work well alone as I am always striving to bring 100% to the work that I do, but I’m also at my best when collaborating with others.
Organization Description 1: AXA is a French multinational insurance firm headquartered in the 8th arrondissement of Paris that engages in global insurance, investment management, and other financial services. The AXA Group operates primarily in Western Europe, North America, the Asia Pacific region, and the Middle East, with presence also in Africa.  I am really happy that I got to learn more about the process of project management and also the agile framework that is widely used in AXA.  Roles and Responsibility: Support and assist senior management with day to day project delivery items. Work with senior project managers to support change management for the business (communications, workshops, trainings) Assist with project report and co-ordination  Below are some of my takeaways from this internship: Managing UATs When I first joined the company, the team had a system that had just went live. As the system is at its initial stage, there are a lot of teething problems and enhancements to be made to the system. Hence, the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) is very important to ensure the system is bug free and I was tasked to administer the UAT sessions. I would need to follow up with all the users and ensure that they completed their UAT on time so that the project could be deployed according to schedule.  Gathering Project Requirements I was also tasked to attend meetings with the different business users of the system such as the tied agents and agents to understand what are the changes they would like to see in the new system and what other functions would like to incorporate in the new system. see less
Organization Description 2: DHL is the world’s first contract logistics provider. They have a major contract logistics presence in over 60 countries across all regions of the world. With their global presence, they mainly leverage on: • International expertise across industry sectors • A commitment to deliver consistently excellent operations in every geography • Common processes for project management and continuous improvement Together with DHL’s unique combination of global outreach and local expertise, DHL has the technology, infrastructure and people in place to manage end-to-end distribution, worldwide. By combining DHL’s contract logistics capabilities with DHL’s capabilities in global forwarding, freight, express and global mail, DHL is able to provide end-to-end supply chain solutions across more than 220 countries and territories worldwide.  This internship experience was indeed a meaningful and fulfilling one as I was given the opportunity to add value in the company in the following aspects: - Analyzing the system to reduce inefficiencies in the system to source for cost saving opportunities - Scheduling/Planning an iteration of the project - Handling Global Users and analyzing the QuoteShop System to discover bugs and bugs fixing  I am really grateful that I am able to gain a lot from this experience and some of my takeaways are being able to learn to: - Communicate efficiently with global users and understanding their problems/issues - Analyze requirements list from different countries and coming out with cost saving solutions - Understand the project enhancement process see less

Title: Business Undergraduate at Singapore Management University
Summary: A Business student at the Singapore Management University (SMU), majoring in Marketing and Strategic Management. I am passionate about helping companies build their brand equity through compelling strategies. My past internship experiences at a US cyber-security firm and a global market research firm have opened my eyes to the power of digital transformation - which I believe will be the mainstay of the century.   In university, I served as part of the Executive Committee of the SMU EYE Investment Club and was selected to undergo vigorous training to be a trainer at the Citi-SMU Financial Literacy Club, a Citi-backed social initiative to heighten financial literacy awareness among young adults.  Furthermore, as an SMU Ambassador, I am part of a core team that engages with officials and foreign delegates on their visits to SMU. The experiences that I have gleaned through my involvement in school have developed my critical-thinking, problem-solving and stakeholder management skills.  I am excited to explore the fields of marketing, corporate communications, partnerships and HR. I believe that brand strategies should always have the customer at its core, as it is key to strengthening user engagement and building trust in a brand. If you are a fellow brand enthusiast and avid tech lover, or just want to say hi, feel free to connect. Would love to have a chat!

Title: Business Analyst - COO Office at Bank of Singapore, Asia's Global Private Bank
Summary: I have recently graduated from Singapore Management University with a Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, majoring in both Corporate Communications and Arts and Culture Management.   8 of my past 18 months were spent at the private bank Bank of Singapore, assuming 2 different internship positions with the COO Office and Marketing team respectively. While this meant a delayed graduation, I found the tradeoff for valuable experience and insight to the private banking world worthy. This extended amount of time with one institution  not only gave me deepened insight into how various functions interact and work together across teams, it provided significant learning opportunities through working on major events such as the Bank’s thought-leadership event “A Moderated Conversation with President Barack Obama”.  I am always pursuing new ways of growing and moving out of my comfort zone. For instance, I spent a summer in Italy as the Communications Manager for an art biennale, establishing connections with brilliant minds in the art world while writing press releases, liaising with magazines, managing social media accounts, and working on the biennale catalog. Later that year, I competed for a one-month long stint at The Travel Intern, which took me to 4 countries and exposed me to the previously unfamiliar world of travel writing and video creation. Besides learning how to generate SEO-optimised articles, I was challenged daily with sponsored activities like completing the world’s highest manmade bungee jump, all of which were documented on web video series The Travel Intern Life.  No matter how inconvenient, unlikely, or foreign, my willingness to learn and zealousness to grow both professionally and personally have taken me to and through many new experiences, cultures, and environments. Most recently, I received a Certificate of Distinction in a Python Programming course and remain motivated to advance my Python programming skills in the second half of 2019.

Title: Public Relations Intern at HBO Asia
Summary: “With Great Power comes Great Responsibility.”  Albeit that being a cheesy phrase ranging on a scale of One to Spiderman, power is intrinsically woven into the essence of all societies. My interest in global and domestic affairs made me embark on this journey of Political Science; a journey in which I can discover more about how power plays a role in the way people and societies function. Additionally, given the importance of Communications in strengthening relationships between individuals and even organizations, I am also interested in how Communications can be used in branding and building an organization's corporate reputation.   Having resided in countries outside of Singapore (such as France, Spain and the United States), my global exposure has rendered me adaptable and receptive to novel experiences since young. I am confident in taking my cultural awareness and people-skills to every aspect of my work.   Moreover, I am passionate about causes I feel strongly for, such as Environmental Conservation and Women's/Children's Rights. This passion is translated to my active volunteering at organizations such as the National Parks Board Singapore and a voluntary internship stint at World Vision International (Singapore). Volunteering has taught me the importance of communities and the dynamism of teamwork to generate effective change.

Title: Engineer at Singtel
Summary: I have been working in the telecommunications industry for 4 years as a charging engineer in SingTel Mobile Network Engineering department.  It has been a fruitful journey honing various technical skill such as Unix, IP connectivity etc and familiarization of industry standards such as GSM, 3GPP etc. Moreover, I have also attended security courses such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP).  Additionally, I had the humble opportunity to be a Project manager for key projects such as TPG integration project (charging track) where I oversee a successful User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for inter-operator voice and short message service (sms) calls between SingTel and TPG.  Prior to working, I have graduated from Singapore Management University with a Bachelor of Science (Information Systems) and a second major in Finance.   I have diverse experiences in working with peers from various faculties and different universities. In SMU, my project teams have achieved various awards such as SMU Software Engineering Star Awards 2012 (Credit Suisse) - 1st Runner-Up, National Library Board best IT Strategy advisory award.  I have also interned as an Information Technology (IT) developer at various companies such as Extentia (Pune, India) and Appic Technologies. The overseas internship with Extentia in India was a truly invaluable experience. During the internship, I was exposed to a wide variety of tasks, including developing websites and writing web services for mobile developers. I learnt to familiarize myself with industry coding conventions, debug problems efficiently and work under pressure. Besides these technical skills, I was immersed into the local culture and learnt important skills such as teamwork and good communication.
